HTML5
Markup language used for structuring and presenting content on the World Wide Web.
CSS3
The latest evolution of the Cascading Style Sheets language and aims at extending CSS2.1.
JavaScript
High-level, dynamic, untyped, and interpreted programming language.
JQuery
Cross-platform JavaScript library designed to simplify the client-side scripting of HTML.
Pug (Jade)
Bust, elegant, feature rich template engine for Node.js.
Stylus
Dynamic stylesheet language that is compiled into Cascading Style Sheets (CSS).
Gulp
JavaScript task runner that lets automate tasks.
BEM
Methodology, that helps to achieve reusable components and code sharing in the front-end.
Bootstrap
Front-end framework for faster and easier web development.
Mobile-First
The technique of creating mobile websites first and then progressively enhancing them to create the desktop version.
GitHub
A free and open source distributed version control system.
Linux command line
I use Linux (Linux Mint) and really love it.
